BL_KP_P9.text: six individuals have their heads turned to look down upon an enormous, overhanging structure that is towering above them.: The artworks displayed here relate to Art Nouveau themes such as balconies, structures with low ceilings (elements), high windows (objects) or outdoor areas for protection from rain and wind. These elements usually include glass panels, painted wood paneling, brickwork, shingle roofs; all depicted abstractly but also show subtle detail - stonework, wall decorations or even natural materials like branches sprouting out of trees etc. You may be able find works featuring these designs online because they're often featured free-of charge through website portals mentioned below. One example would read :TheartWorks exhibited this artwork earlier this year when it was installed alongside others along Union Street during New York City's annual World AIDS Day parade ceremony [1].
